alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 9:33PM EDT until April 18 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. .Water levels along the Middle Branch of the Escanaba River at Humboldt have receded some and are no longer in flood stage. This Flood Warning has been canceled and replaced with a Flood Advisory. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt are occurring. * WHERE...Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, County Road FX begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Monday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.2 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 130 PM EDT.
